channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Natural Language as Polices: Reasoning for Coordinate-Level Embodied Control with LLMs
item.description: We demonstrate experimental results with LLMs that address robotics action planning problems.

item.title: An Ordering of Divergences for Variational Inference with Factorized Gaussian Approximations
item.description: Our analysis covers the KL divergence, the R\'enyi divergences, and a score-based divergence that compares $\nabla\log p$ and $\nabla\log q$.

item.title: Scaling Diffusion Models to Real-World 3D LiDAR Scene Completion
item.description: Our experimental evaluation shows that our method can complete the scene given a single LiDAR scan as input, producing a scene with more details compared to state-of-the-art scene completion methods.

item.title: Grounding Spatial Relations in Text-Only Language Models
item.description: This paper shows that text-only Language Models (LM) can learn to ground spatial relations like "left of" or "below" if they are provided with explicit location information of objects and they are properly trained to leverage those locations.

item.title: Nellie: Automated organelle segmentation, tracking, and hierarchical feature extraction in 2D/3D live-cell microscopy
item.description: The analysis of dynamic organelles remains a formidable challenge, though key to understanding biological processes.

item.title: RewardBench: Evaluating Reward Models for Language Modeling
item.description: In this paper, we present RewardBench, a benchmark dataset and code-base for evaluation, to enhance scientific understanding of reward models.

item.title: Diversity-aware Channel Pruning for StyleGAN Compression
item.description: Specifically, by assessing channel importance based on their sensitivities to latent vector perturbations, our method enhances the diversity of samples in the compressed model.

item.title: LlamaFactory: Unified Efficient Fine-Tuning of 100+ Language Models
item.description: Efficient fine-tuning is vital for adapting large language models (LLMs) to downstream tasks.

item.title: Meta-Point Learning and Refining for Category-Agnostic Pose Estimation
item.description: Existing methods only rely on the features extracted at support keypoints to predict or refine the keypoints on query image, but a few support feature vectors are local and inadequate for CAPE.

item.title: H-vmunet: High-order Vision Mamba UNet for Medical Image Segmentation
item.description: In the field of medical image segmentation, variant models based on Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs) and Visual Transformers (ViTs) as the base modules have been very widely developed and applied.

item.title: Self-Supervised Class-Agnostic Motion Prediction with Spatial and Temporal Consistency Regularizations
item.description: To this end, we explore the feasibility of self-supervised motion prediction with only unlabeled LiDAR point clouds.

item.title: Practical End-to-End Optical Music Recognition for Pianoform Music
item.description: (c) We train and fine-tune an end-to-end model to serve as a baseline on the dataset and employ the TEDn metric to evaluate the model.

item.title: PuzzleVQA: Diagnosing Multimodal Reasoning Challenges of Language Models with Abstract Visual Patterns
item.description: As recognizing patterns and abstracting concepts are key to general intelligence, we introduce PuzzleVQA, a collection of puzzles based on abstract patterns.

item.title: Mora: Enabling Generalist Video Generation via A Multi-Agent Framework
item.description: Sora is the first large-scale generalist video generation model that garnered significant attention across society.

item.title: MTP: Advancing Remote Sensing Foundation Model via Multi-Task Pretraining
item.description: However, transferring the pretrained models to downstream tasks may encounter task discrepancy due to their formulation of pretraining as image classification or object discrimination tasks.

item.title: A Sampling-based Framework for Hypothesis Testing on Large Attributed Graphs
item.description: Experiments on real datasets demonstrate the ability of our framework to leverage common graph sampling methods for hypothesis testing, and the superiority of hypothesis-aware sampling in terms of accuracy and time efficiency.

item.title: Arcee's MergeKit: A Toolkit for Merging Large Language Models
item.description: The rapid expansion of the open-source language model landscape presents an opportunity to merge the competencies of these model checkpoints by combining their parameters.

item.title: Uncertainty quantification for data-driven weather models
item.description: In a case study on medium-range forecasts of selected weather variables over Europe, the probabilistic forecasts obtained by using the Pangu-Weather model in concert with uncertainty quantification methods show promising results and provide improvements over ensemble forecasts from the physics-based ensemble weather model of the European Centre for Medium-Range Weather Forecasts for lead times of up to 5 days.

item.title: Dynamic Reward Adjustment in Multi-Reward Reinforcement Learning for Counselor Reflection Generation
item.description: In this paper, we study the problem of multi-reward reinforcement learning to jointly optimize for multiple text qualities for natural language generation.

item.title: Retina Vision Transformer (RetinaViT): Introducing Scaled Patches into Vision Transformers
item.description: Humans see low and high spatial frequency components at the same time, and combine the information from both to form a visual scene.

item.title: DESIRE-ME: Domain-Enhanced Supervised Information REtrieval using Mixture-of-Experts
item.description: Open-domain question answering requires retrieval systems able to cope with the diverse and varied nature of questions, providing accurate answers across a broad spectrum of query types and topics.

item.title: Generalizable and Stable Finetuning of Pretrained Language Models on Low-Resource Texts
item.description: Pretrained Language Models (PLMs) have advanced Natural Language Processing (NLP) tasks significantly, but finetuning PLMs on low-resource datasets poses significant challenges such as instability and overfitting.

item.title: Dynamic Spatial-Temporal Aggregation for Skeleton-Aware Sign Language Recognition
item.description: Current methods utilize spatial graph modules and temporal modules to capture spatial and temporal features, respectively.

item.title: FedFisher: Leveraging Fisher Information for One-Shot Federated Learning
item.description: Standard federated learning (FL) algorithms typically require multiple rounds of communication between the server and the clients, which has several drawbacks, including requiring constant network connectivity, repeated investment of computational resources, and susceptibility to privacy attacks.

item.title: Just Shift It: Test-Time Prototype Shifting for Zero-Shot Generalization with Vision-Language Models
item.description: Advancements in vision-language models (VLMs) have propelled the field of computer vision, particularly in the zero-shot learning setting.

item.title: FlowerFormer: Empowering Neural Architecture Encoding using a Flow-aware Graph Transformer
item.description: The success of a specific neural network architecture is closely tied to the dataset and task it tackles; there is no one-size-fits-all solution.

item.title: Privacy-Preserving Face Recognition Using Trainable Feature Subtraction
item.description: Recognizable identity features within the image are encouraged by co-training a recognition model on its high-dimensional feature representation.

item.title: Evolutionary Optimization of Model Merging Recipes
item.description: Surprisingly, our Japanese Math LLM achieved state-of-the-art performance on a variety of established Japanese LLM benchmarks, even surpassing models with significantly more parameters, despite not being explicitly trained for such tasks.

item.title: Non-negative Contrastive Learning
item.description: In this paper, we propose Non-negative Contrastive Learning (NCL), a renaissance of Non-negative Matrix Factorization (NMF) aimed at deriving interpretable features.

item.title: FRESCO: Spatial-Temporal Correspondence for Zero-Shot Video Translation
item.description: In this paper, we introduce FRESCO, intra-frame correspondence alongside inter-frame correspondence to establish a more robust spatial-temporal constraint.

item.title: Generalized Consistency Trajectory Models for Image Manipulation
item.description: Diffusion-based generative models excel in unconditional generation, as well as on applied tasks such as image editing and restoration.

item.title: Inter- and intra-uncertainty based feature aggregation model for semi-supervised histopathology image segmentation
item.description: To address these issues, we first propose a novel inter- and intra-uncertainty regularization method to measure and constrain both inter- and intra-inconsistencies in the teacher-student architecture.

item.title: Confusing Pair Correction Based on Category Prototype for Domain Adaptation under Noisy Environments
item.description: In this paper, we address unsupervised domain adaptation under noisy environments, which is more challenging and practical than traditional domain adaptation.

item.title: VQ-NeRV: A Vector Quantized Neural Representation for Videos
item.description: This block incorporates a codebook mechanism to discretize the network's shallow residual features and inter-frame residual information effectively.

item.title: Equity through Access: A Case for Small-scale Deep Learning
item.description: The recent advances in deep learning (DL) have been accelerated by access to large-scale data and compute.

item.title: Policy Bifurcation in Safe Reinforcement Learning
item.description: Safe reinforcement learning (RL) offers advanced solutions to constrained optimal control problems.

item.title: Ultra-High-Resolution Image Synthesis with Pyramid Diffusion Model
item.description: We introduce the Pyramid Diffusion Model (PDM), a novel architecture designed for ultra-high-resolution image synthesis.

item.title: You Only Sample Once: Taming One-Step Text-To-Image Synthesis by Self-Cooperative Diffusion GANs
item.description: We introduce YOSO, a novel generative model designed for rapid, scalable, and high-fidelity one-step image synthesis.

item.title: FouriScale: A Frequency Perspective on Training-Free High-Resolution Image Synthesis
item.description: In this study, we delve into the generation of high-resolution images from pre-trained diffusion models, addressing persistent challenges, such as repetitive patterns and structural distortions, that emerge when models are applied beyond their trained resolutions.

item.title: Class and Region-Adaptive Constraints for Network Calibration
item.description: In particular, we present a formulation that integrates class and region-wise constraints into the learning objective, with multiple penalty weights to account for class and region differences.

item.title: ERASE: Benchmarking Feature Selection Methods for Deep Recommender Systems
item.description: Secondly, the existing literature's lack of detailed analysis on selection attributes, based on large-scale datasets and a thorough comparison among selection techniques and DRS backbones, restricts the generalizability of findings and impedes deployment on DRS.

item.title: Characteristic AI Agents via Large Language Models
item.description: In response to this research gap, we create a benchmark for the characteristic AI agents task, including dataset, techniques, and evaluation metrics.

item.title: On Predictive planning and counterfactual learning in active inference
item.description: Given the rapid advancement of artificial intelligence, understanding the foundations of intelligent behaviour is increasingly important.

item.title: Agent-FLAN: Designing Data and Methods of Effective Agent Tuning for Large Language Models
item.description: Open-sourced Large Language Models (LLMs) have achieved great success in various NLP tasks, however, they are still far inferior to API-based models when acting as agents.

item.title: mPLUG-DocOwl 1.5: Unified Structure Learning for OCR-free Document Understanding
item.description: In this work, we emphasize the importance of structure information in Visual Document Understanding and propose the Unified Structure Learning to boost the performance of MLLMs.

item.title: Do Generated Data Always Help Contrastive Learning?
item.description: Contrastive Learning (CL) has emerged as one of the most successful paradigms for unsupervised visual representation learning, yet it often depends on intensive manual data augmentations.

item.title: Memory-Efficient and Secure DNN Inference on TrustZone-enabled Consumer IoT Devices
item.description: We design a memory-efficient management method to support memory-demanding inference in TEEs.

item.title: Comparing Explanation Faithfulness between Multilingual and Monolingual Fine-tuned Language Models
item.description: Previous studies have explored how different factors affect faithfulness, mainly in the context of monolingual English models.

item.title: Instructing Large Language Models to Identify and Ignore Irrelevant Conditions
item.description: Lastly it instructs the LLMs with the verification on relevant and irrelevant conditions to avoid confusion and improve reasoning paths.

item.title: Finding the Missing Data: A BERT-inspired Approach Against Package Loss in Wireless Sensing
item.description: Despite the development of various deep learning methods for Wi-Fi sensing, package loss often results in noncontinuous estimation of the Channel State Information (CSI), which negatively impacts the performance of the learning models.
